description:
🔊 Recorded at PyCon DE & PyData Berlin 2024, 24.04.2024
https://2024.pycon.de/program/BFYUUJ/

🎓 Watch the PyLadies Panel at PyCon PyData engage in a thought-provoking debate on challenging narratives in tech feminism, fostering open dialogue and community solidarity.

Speakers:
Cheuk Ting Ho, Katharine Jarmul, Paloma Oliveira, Naa Ashiorkor Nortey

Description:
At the PyLadies Panel at PyCon PyData, experts Cheuk Ting Ho, Katharine Jarmul, Paloma Oliveira, and Naa Ashiorkor Nortey engage in critical discussions on gender disparities and the importance of women-focused tech groups. This year, inspired by Lucy Delap’s “Feminisms: A Global History,” the panel delves into challenging narratives within the feminist movement, advocating for inclusivity and diversity. The structured debate format encourages deep reflection, aiming to dismantle binary thinking and uncover nuances in common discourse. By critiquing prevailing frameworks of feminism in tech, the panelists seek to pave the way for a more equitable future, promoting inclusivity and equity. Through candid discussions and idea exchanges, the panel provides a platform for marginalized voices, fostering understanding and progress in the tech industry. Join this debate to challenge the status quo, identify systemic flaws, and collectively shape the future of feminism in technology.

⭐️ About PyCon DE & PyData Berlin:
The PyCon DE & PyData conference unite the Python, AI, and data science communities, offering a unique platform for collaboration and innovation. The PyCon DE & PyData Berlin 2024 conference, hosted in partnership with the local Berlin PyData chapter, provided an exceptional experience, fostering deeper connections within the Python community while showcasing advancements in AI and data science. Attendees enjoyed a diverse and engaging program, solidifying the event as a highlight for Python and AI enthusiasts nationwide.

About:
Python Softwareverband e.V.:
PySV is a non-profit that promotes the use and development of Python in Germany through events, education, and advocacy, fostering an open Python community.

NumFOCUS Inc.
supports open-source scientific computing by providing financial and logistical support to key projects like NumPy and Jupyter, promoting sustainable development and collaboration.

Pioneers Hub gemeinnützige GmbH:
is a non-profit fostering innovation in AI and tech by connecting experts and promoting knowledge exchange through events and collaborative initiatives.
title: (PyLadies Panel) Reflecting Within: Challenging Narratives in Tech Feminism
